meanings.definition: Used as an intensifier or expletive to express anger or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Frigging! I can't believe I missed the bus again!
meanings.sent2: Oh frigging heck, I forgot my lunch at home.
meanings.sent3: Well, frigging great, now it's raining and I forgot my umbrella.
meanings.sent4: The frigging traffic was like a never-ending nightmare.
meanings.sent5: The frigging noise from the construction site was unbearable.

meanings.definition: Used as a euphemism for a stronger expletive.
meanings.sent1: Frigging! That scared the living daylights out of me!
meanings.sent2: Oh frigging shoot, I dropped my phone again.
meanings.sent3: Frigging A! I can't believe I locked myself out of the house.
meanings.sent4: The frigging spider in the bathroom was the size of a small car.
meanings.sent5: The frigging thunderstorm made the whole house shake.

meanings.definition: Used informally to emphasize a point or statement.
meanings.sent1: She was frigging tired after running the marathon.
meanings.sent2: I am frigging serious about starting a new hobby.
meanings.sent3: He ate the whole pizza by himself, frigging impressive!
meanings.sent4: The frigging sunset painted the sky in shades of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The frigging mountain stood majestically against the clear blue sky.
